intro: Drimia brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved African lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale purple flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Drimia brevifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in temperate climates.
